page.title: 01Local History.Fareham
page.content: {FAREHAM}is a town which has a long history of commerce and trade.An old seaport-now silted up -there is a large creek with boating facilities of all kinds. A modern tower block houses the local government administration and a very large shopping prescinct attracts shoppers from as far away as twenty miles. The town is a mixture of ancient and modern,combined quite successfully,The population expansion makes house building a growth industry and a Solent City stretching from Portsmouth in the east,to Southampton in the west,was envisaged as long ago as 1970. St's Peter and Paul is the oldest church in the town,having parts dating back to Saxon times.
